text: Mabel Todd (August 13, 1907 – June 2, 1977) was an American actress. ==Early years== Todd was from Glendale and attended the University of Southern California. == Career == Todd performed in vaudeville as a singer, dancer, and comedienne. Todd appeared in films such as Varsity Show, Over the Goal, Hollywood Hotel, Gold Diggers in Paris, Garden of the Moon, The Cowboy and the Lady, The Mysterious Miss X, Mystery of the White Room, Street of Missing Men, Blues in the Night, The Talk of the Town, The Ghost and the Guest, In Society, A Wave, a WAC and a Marine, Down Missouri Way and Wife Wanted, among others. == Personal life == In 1932, Todd married Morey Amsterdam. They divorced in 1945. She married Matthew A. Santino on November 14, 1947, in Las Vegas, and they divorced on April 28, 1950. On June 2, 1977, Todd died in Los Angeles, California. Todd is buried at Queen of Heaven Cemetery in Rowland Heights, California. ==Filmography== === Film === {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role !
